author: Yazmine Choudry
comment: Brilliant app! Great for controlling the laptop when it's plugged into the TV and not too expensive. It does seem to have problems every once in a while and once it's open it won't close, unless I restart my phone! A minor convenience but still annoying.

author: Matt Heath
comment: This used to work so amazing for me I bought the pro version straight away. Somewhere within the last 6 to 9 months something must have changed on their end. Now can never connect to WiFi no matter what I try. Now I'm forced to use a competitors app instead because it works without error. Sad. :(

author: Mr A
comment: Great app, use daily for controlling my mess mix match of Kodi, wmc & potplayer.   It saves me having to move for 30 min to an hour at a time.  Highly recommended.  Would love to see a skinning feature.  Good work developer!

author: Michael Elkevizth
comment: It does the job, but the interface could certainly use some improvements.  For instance the right click and, drag and drop on the mouse control are very hard to use compared to the Gmote app.  Also, the VLC control forces you to use a hard coded password.  Still needs some refinement.

author: 8mugsy8
comment: Has been great for what it is. Really badly needs a middle mouse click function. Other than that there is room for improvement in a few places but not many of them matter much. It's still not a replacement for anything hardware wise.... But it does feel like it comes kinda close sometimes.

author: Bogdan Voaidas
comment: Great app but, i never managed to use widgets in a stable manner. Even now after many smartphones, android versions, app versions, i am not able to have a working widget setup. App crashes, i loose all the widgets, create again widgets, they stop working and so on. and after a while a bother again and then same issues. kind of annoying

author: Cal Reese
comment: App is dogshit. It's nice when it works but it doesn't work often. I'll try to get it to connect for 5-10 minutes, no success, start a YouTube video or something locally at my laptop, go sit down, not touch anything on my phone, and then a couple minutes later when I pick my phone back up the connection is working. Extremely frustrating and unacceptable.

author: Marek Argent
comment: It is still the weakest part of the multi-device and multi-app controlling. Configuring an application (a media player) or a new device takes a few minutes. Creating a custom remote takes half an hour. Connecting both devices may take a few seconds, but it may take long days. Everything depends in what mood is the Unified Remote app.

author: Gary Thompson
comment: It's a great app. There's a fairly annoying persistent bug, though. Whenever I close the app, the first action I try to preform after reopening will cause it to pop up a "WiFi Connection Problem" message for a while until it starts working again.

author: Austin Schlatter
comment: I use this on a daily basis.  Works as intended. However it would be nice to have a button added to the hulu web remote to go to the next video rather than having to use the basic input remote to use the mouse.  Hard to see the mouse on a computer screen from 15ft.

author: Mig S. Kirschman
comment: Allows me to control my arcade cabinet's brain (a simple PC) without opening it up.  Great tool that continues to get better!  Developer resolved a bug for me within the week that I alerted them to it!

author: Martin Pucovski
comment: Till a month ago, a good application. In the last month, definitely the worst app I have ever bought. The File Manager didn't work for a long time and now, after the update, I could not add widgets. Tried to reinstall, which was a big mistake, because I couldn't disable notifications. That got fixed, but now the connection keeps dropping on wifi.

author: Joshua Booth
comment: With its inbuilt VNC support, this app has it all. I set up quick buttons in my notification bar that map to YouTube keyboard shortcuts. I made a custom remote layout that acts as a gamepad. Everything can be customized and it's incredible. There are a few things that took a bit to get used to - like when you set the volume, it first turns the volume all the way down and then increases it back up. But once you've figured the quirks out, you'll be amazed by how much this app can do.

author: Yasen Milenkov
comment: Ever since i actually bought the full version i have been having trouble connecting with my PC. I have tried everything, preinstalling, manually adding the server LAN and WAN numbers. It is wierd tha you don't have customer support or reporting problems, so I am writing down mine here in hope somebody sees it. I like this app, it is the best at what it is, bu only as long as it works, I even payed for it and what I am getting is worse than the free version. Please devs/supoort/or at least someone, help out a guy who supports your product it is much appreciated.

author: chad long
comment: Love this app. Bought full version to support. But my wifi is down and I can no longer use. Please include a Bluetooth connection like some other similar apps. I would hate to have to switch over to them just because they have this other feature. So please add Bluetooth connection.

author: Santiago Navatta
comment: I love it! It's super useful. But I'd love to have a way to make the floating icon transparent while idle. That and the fact that they are quite awful to look at. Other than that it's quite a handy app.

author: Jacob Derington
comment: Runs perfectly. I turned an old laptop into a smart TV that is controlled with my wife's phone and mine so who ever needs a action done it's there. Love it. Couple of things I would like to see are: the quick action notification to be removed when disconnected from wifi or something and a way to switch between currently open windows easily.

author: Jacob Wolf
comment: I have been using Unified Remote for a few years now. I have brought it through several phones, and I have it on 2 of my home PCs. I am very pleased with the app. There are some issues when versions between devices are out of sync with one another, but simply updating your device resolves this quickly. I would highly recommend it.
It is the best in the West! The only thing I can point out is that it doesn't work with an Android box. But, as far as I'm aware, the Unified Temote team is working on it. So I hope the best!

author: Giedrius Kuliešius
comment: Connection is great, input lag is minimal, no issues with most functions. However, screen view maps inputs to a side on my PC (likely due to dual monitors), which makes it nearly unusable, so I can't give the app full marks

author: Dennis Dyall
comment: Been using for years and I think it's the best out there. BUT recently the Remote Server on my Windows 10 started crashing randomly without any error messages in the log

author: Harris Kontos
comment: Excellent app. Works flawlessly. No bugs, no lag. Includes keyboard. Connection via wi fi. You don't have to enable Bluetooth connection. Full version has more features such as volume control and more.

author: Alex Ceja
comment: Have used this app for a while on different devices and it has worked beautifully. But now that I have a galaxy s8 plus, the screen goes black and the app freezes when I try to set up quick actions for my phone. Needs to be fixed.

author: Dave K
comment: This and, the now defunct, gesture search are my two favorite apps. I use my pc as my main entertainment center and having a remote for it is just the best. Easy set up as well. I bought the pro version just to show my support as you get plenty of features in the free version as well. Keep up the good work

author: James Culpepper
comment: Picked it up on sale after using the free version for a long time. Most useful purchase I've made all year. Set up is simple, usage is simple. Simple and brilliant

author: Inky Hates Most Things
comment: While its not without its problems, the app works as advertised. Some small complants, though: Occasionally you have to restart the app because it stops working entirely, and the screen-viewing feature only records your primary monitor, not any others you might have.

author: Thomas Gregorio
comment: App specific remotes and a great basic input control as well. If you're consuming media and aren't gaming or creating content, this is good enough to replace a mouse and keyboard

author: Ian Nolan
comment: I can't overstate how useful this app is. Dedicated remotes for many popular programs (Netflix, Spotify, Firefox, etc.). The controls are intuitive and the interface is easy to navigate.

author: Rafael Fontana
comment: Used to be buggy, dcying all the time or not finding the server at all, but not abymore Haven't had any connection problems in about 2 years. Completely essential in any phone.

author: Will Mackaness
comment: It's pretty good. A little out of date now (interfaces are a little shoddy if I had to pick at hairs) but still very very good.

author: Al Barc
comment: Lowering review after finding that their forum is dead and their answer to where to find support is "Ask someone else". When emailing for support they never respond. They take your money and give you nothing in return for it. Look elsewhere if you want to support devs who care about their customers.

author: Mathew Martin
comment: Everything I wanted and more. Only issue I have is there doesn't appear to be any dual/multi-monitor support for the desktop view. Otherwise perfect, nice work.

author: Jacob Sedore
comment: Coming from a computer programming student, amazing. After using the free version I had to buy the full version. Not only because the app is so well designed and has the smoothest interface, but because the developers behind this project deserve it. Enjoy the beer I just bought you guys!

author: Sloan Stewart
comment: This works incredibly well. Using a phone as essentially a touchpad and then having the phones on screen keyboard send to the computer is awesome.  In my current use case, I didn't have an extra keyboard and mouse for setting up a Raspberry Pi, so I used this app to control my windows pc while having my real keyboard and mouse hooked to the Raspberry Pi. It works perfectly!  Ive also used this app to control my PC from the bed for watching Amazon video or whatever.

author: mrkings41
comment: It's a great app only issue is that it disconnects most times which renders the remote unresponsive.  Other wise it's packed with great features and it's future is very bright  kudos to it's developers.

author: Nguyen Bao
comment: Everything is good. A small inconvenient is that screen viewer is unstable. Worth 4 stars.

author: Joseph O'Hara
comment: Really useful I highly recommend buying the full version. I congrstulate the creators of this app because it seems like a pain to have created.

author: Anthony Vega
comment: Excellent function! I can use it as a perfectly working remote mouse to do anything on my computer. Best feature for me is the remote mouse and volume control. I gave it only 4 stars because I would enjoy a nice interface and design, otherwise, excellent app!

author: Mark L.
comment: Still one of the best remote utilities for Windows PCs! Comes in very handy in a varying set of situations while server is lightweight enough to be sitting there in stand-by even during gaming.
Nice app. Got the paid version after using the free one for a few days.  Disconnects a lot on my 5ghz network. Other than that it works great.
